data.message:
keeping in touch frequently is necessary 
to show that we still remember each other even when we're separated. 
however it can get pretty awkward suddenly coming up 
and saying hello, asking what they've been up to and all.
back then that was basically the only means of catching up.
also, it can even be a waste of time sometimes. 

but now, there are new ways in staying connected 
without saying a word at all;
just by begin following each other on our pages, 
we liking their stuffs, they liking ours back,
we sharing whatever they've added, they sharing ours in return, 
and the both of us get notified that we've been watching 
what the other party's been doing all this while, the entire time. 

it's especially useful for myself 
who's the type who gets rather tensed up 
when i accidentally bump into someone i've not met in years 
and begin saying silly things and asking silly questions
because i feel obligated to show i enjoy 
the rare and unexpected conversations.

but now, we keep in touch like every single day in this manner.
and it's both very educational and entertaining 
to learn more about ourselves 
by seeing what others do that we don't, 
borrowing their influences 
and implementing them into our daily lives. 

i begin liking things i used to never take notice of 
when i was a child; the same goes for them.
we learn from each other through facebook ^_^ 
Happy 12th Birthday Facebook!
